Uplink HARQ Retransmissions per Round per RNTI

panels.description: PRACH I0 (dB) represents the estimated interference and noise power level on the Physical Random Access Channel (PRACH) as measured by the gNB. It reflects the background energy in the PRACH resources, impacting the gNB's ability to detect random access preambles from UEs. A lower I0 value indicates a cleaner channel with less interference, improving the chances of successful UE access attempts, while a higher I0 suggests a noisy or congested environment that may hinder initial access. Monitoring this metric helps assess PRACH quality and network accessibility under varying load and interference conditions.
